intro: Acmadenia alternifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features narrow, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. The species is part of the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage.
